summary: Email correspondence between a Co-Chief of the Narcotics Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and an unidentified recipient regarding the review of a report related to Epstein. The email discusses conditions for reviewing the document, including attorney-eyes-only treatment and no reproduction.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Narcotics Unit
persons.role: Co-Chief, Narcotics Unit at U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email setting conditions for reviewing an Epstein-related report and responding to a request from another individual.

events.title: Report Review Request
events.description: An individual requested to review an Epstein report, and the Co-Chief of the Narcotics Unit set conditions for the review, including attorney-eyes-only treatment and no reproduction.

events.title: Follow-up on Report Review
events.description: Email exchange where the Co-Chief acknowledges a missed meeting to review the Epstein report and discusses the report's handling while the requester is away.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York's Narcotics Unit was involved in handling an Epstein-related report in December 2019.
Access to the Epstein report was restricted under attorney-eyes-only conditions and prohibited reproduction.
The email correspondence indicates coordination between legal officials regarding the review of sensitive Epstein case materials.
